snippet: A fight with WhatsApp, the world’s largest mobile messaging service, would open a new front in the Obama administration’s dispute with Silicon Valley over encryption, security and privacy.
abstract: Justice Dept is engaged in debate with mobile messaging service WhatsApp over access to encrypted messages on company's server; department has been stymied by company's encryption in criminal investigation for which wiretap order has been granted; debate parallels that over department's request to Apple for access to encrypted iPhone used by San Bernardino, Calif, attacker.

byline.contributor: Eric Lichtblau contributed reporting from Washington and Katie Benner from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: A fight with WhatsApp, the world’s largest mobile messaging service, would open a new front in the Obama administration’s dispute with Silicon Valley over encryption, security and privacy.

headline.main: WhatsApp Encryption Said to Stymie Wiretap Order
headline.print_headline: Messaging App Is Latest Front in Tech Debate

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
